I come here to watch football almost weekly. Service here is great! My waitress Hayley is the best!! She remembers me and my order and is so sweet! I will keep coming back just for her!

Ps, I really enjoy their wild sauce on traditional wings and potato wedges

This is the worst BWW I have ever been to.. Very sad since I'm a huge fan.. I ordered a large boneless meal for carry out and specifically asked for extra sauce.  
When I got home, I was sorely disappointed to find that not only was there NOT extra sauce, it was even less than you would normally expect.
I called over to speak with the manager who never apologized. He said the amount of sauce was relative which is bonkers considering my wings were bone dry.  He offered to make another batch for me but this was completely inconvenient for me as I had plans for the rest of the evening.  An offer for a future discount, a coupon, even a simple apology would have sufficed..

Shame...
Kyle is the best bartender/server at this restaurant! I highly recommend sitting in his section

Found a cockroach in my wings. Fucking nasty
Update called the restaurant manager tried to get smart w me. I am calling hr tmw will keep ppl updated about this restaurant. Nasty dirty restaurant

First time at this location and had a horrible experience. Took at least 20 min just to get some drinks and when the drinks came they weren't what we ordered. When reanne asked if we were ready to order we replied yes after taking our order she replied with there is a long wait for food over 25 minutes minimum. After taking our order she never returned to ask if we needed anything else. About 30 minutes later she returned with the food dropped it off and and about 10 minutes later she came with the checks saying "take your time no rush." 5 minutes after that while still eating she asks if we had the payment ready. Seemed pretty rushed to me. Anyways I wish I could rate it below 1 star but it'll have to do won't be returning to this location ever which is unfortunate seeing as it is so close to home.

One dollar for a traditional wing. Overpriced? I think so. Not to mention they always forget to include celery with my order when I specifically ask for them. Oh well, their business is booming anyway so they don't care. Just my two cents.

I've been to Buffalo Wild Wings a bunch of times. This was my second time at the Bloomingdale location. Our waitresses name was Reanne. We came in at 11:00 pm on the 27th of September. We sat our table for twenty minutes no one came to ask if we'd like drinks, after we got our drinks Reanne kept telling us that it would be a long wait for food. Which was fine we told her that was ok. We didn't get our food for maybe 25 minutes which was ok. During that entire 25 minutes she did not stop by once to ask if we would like refills. After we got our food she disappeared and did not come back at all for another 20 minutes and then just to give us our checks. Then she came back five minutes later asking if we're ready for the bill. At the point we were still not done eating and hadn't gotten our refills. I understand that it gets busy and it gets stressful sometimes. But we were very patient and respectful and we got really crappy service because it seemed like Reanne was just focused on going home. Not acceptable.

Literally the worst service I have experienced. Came last night at 7 PM on a boneless Thursday night, which I realize means the place is busier than usual, but what happened to my group is just unacceptable. We were seated and ordered our drinks immediately, and about 5 minutes later placed our orders, so far, so good. Then an hour later, our food still hasn't come. It is now approximately 8 PM. Our waitress did not come check on us or update us at all during that hour. Finally someone who was not our waitress delivered our wings to us by basically throwing them on the table, and then quickly turns around and walks off. At this point we are starving, and look at our table and realize... We have no napkins and no silverware. So we hope that our waitress will come by soon so we can ask for some. She walked by our table several times and we were unsuccessful in waving her down. We also tried to get the attention of other servers, who looked is DIRECTLY in the eye, and then did not stop and ask what we needed. I also did not see a manager during this time, if I had I would have attempted to get their attention. So finally, FIFTEEN minutes later, we get the attention of our waitress who brings us silverware a few minutes later. By now our food is cold, but whatever, we were starving. Halfway through eating our waitress does check on us, and she says she will bring us more water. That never happened. We finish and ask for boxes and our checks. Checks come, we pay, but no boxes. We wait another 20 minutes before we are able to flag someone down to get us boxes. Food was good, service was awful.

We live in the middle of 2 Buffalo Wild Wings & always wonder on which one to choose, but by FAR this one is our favorite! On our way here, my friend was telling me on how awesome of service he got last time & luckily enough... He (we) got the same server. Sarah was AMAZING, extremely friendly & super nice! We both had awesome drinks, food & best of all... Service! Thanks Sarah... We will come and ask for you next time :) P.S... This isn't the first time I have great service, this location is amazing!!! :)

This is one of my favorite Buffalo Wild Wings! I always go out of the way to come here for their exceptional service. The staff is responsive to your needs, charismatic, and friendly! It really makes the whole visit much more enjoyable. The food is good quality too, always warm and fresh, at least from what I've seen. I have been served by Sarah, who has provided above and beyond good service each and every time I come. She brings things for you before you even ask and always has a smile on her face! Keep up the good work!
This restaurant smelled so bad walking in, we turned around and walked out. Almost like vinegar, or urine. Not sure what was going on there. Not appetizing at all.

All places have issues.  Overall I have been lucky at the bloomingdale location.   
When they have messed up.  They have fixed and made right.   The capitan or manager cured.  
I like the asain zing.   More well done.   
If anything is wrong make them start all over.. 
Because of fixing issues they went from three to 4 stars.  

Well done and asain zing...   carrots not celery.

Let's see, so it's bdubs which means of coarse the food is going to be delicious. However this was one 9f the worst buffalo wild wings I have ever gone to. First, we were waiting over 20 minutes to be seated and they gave our table to someone else instead and we needed to waiting longer, the waiter was not the best and honestly was not very smart. They messed up from friends order. And our appetizer. 

When you trying to apply for a bdubs staff position, there is an online math and reading test but I swear that there are not many people that seem to have a brain that would at this location, or bdubs in general. I will not be going to this location ever again.. bad service is a bad experience. 

Two thumbs down!!!

I am pretty sure that when you ask for your wings to be "extra wet" - the people in the kitchen read it as "no sauce". Every single time we have gotten wings the last year, we've had to tell them to put more on so the wings were just barely covered.

This last time, the employee tried to not even let me look at the wings before we left, almost as if she already knew it was going to be an issue.

To add to the cheapness, they've apparently determined that a side of fries should consist of less than a half cup.

We have given it enough chances.

I ordered from this location today and when biting into my nachos immediately felt something weird in my mouth, when I spit it out there was a screw in my hand! 
I worked for this company for years and love the food, but this is absolutely unacceptable!

Take a look at the photo. Yes that is a giant hair clump. Yes I did take two big sips. No, the manager didn't seem to care about it or give a good effort to make the situation better. Needless to say I won't be going back to this location.

I dunno...  I've been here a couple of times for lunch and sampled a variety of wings but there's nothing about this place that calls me back.  Dining area and more sports bar area...  The wings are good and they sure do have a selection!  At this location there's been a fellow who serves us in the bar who is great but there's a lady also who is...uh...not so great.  Surly is a good word.  I once ordered the ghost pepper wings (and just so you know, they are freaking HOT!  omg...everyone says they have hot wings but they are pikers next to this)...and that woman brought the wings and then disappeared forever.  No drinks.  Not even a glass of water.  Grrr...

I'm always on the lookout for a good lunch place but but while the food is good, the iffy service makes this a no.

Mediocre chain restaurant.  This location has horrible service so don't come here if you're expecting a quick lunch.  I've always been seated promptly but have sat waiting for a server for 15+ minutes and then, after ordering, waiting up to 30+ minutes for my wings to arrive.  If this happened only once I could give them the benefit of the doubt that they were having a tough day but it happened every time I've been at this location.  I now avoid coming to this location because I always end up being late getting back to work.

Stay away from this place.

I used to love BWW and I was so excited when one opened up 5 minutes from my house! I know some are franchised and some are corporate....but I've just had way too many bad experiences at BWW. I love wings and love their selection of flavors!! The service and quality at BWW though....mostly disappointing. There were handful of staff on and walking around yet they weren't attentive or hospitable.... 

Bartender, if you have a drink special and it's supposed to be a certain ounces, can you please fill the glass? I'd rather not get a drink that looks like someone drank out of.... Thanks

Have had good experiences there. Clean and food comes relatively quickly.  Manager once made me the off-menu Buffalo Grilled Cheese sandwich upon request, it was delicious (from spring 2014, bring it back) and much appreciated.

Staff might need to be updated on the day's sporting events as I've gotten a dear-in-headlights response to a couple of NCAA football requests. Staff also tends to disappear on occasion, which is not great when you have two kids who keep dropping silverware.

Wings are the best in the area, but prices are a little on the high side and I can only justify a visit every couple of months as the tab escalates quickly.
Good place to drink and eat, Weekends is my favorite days to hang out with my fiends in this place.

My wife had never been to a bww before and I have been to the one in Bolingbrook quite a few times. So Saturday we went into the one off Gary ave in Bloomingdale. We were seated by a young man that had the personality of a door. He took us to a table that had all kinds of food on the floor around it. Strike number two. Waitress was very nice but didn't take our order down correctly. They did get the missing items out to us fairly quickly once she came back to our table. Bolingbrook B-Dubs just run much better than this one.

The hosts were fantastic and very nice.

We got seated in the bar which my boyfriend said he did not want. But we let that go..

 The captain came over in right away asked if we wanted something to drink, but got interrupted by our waitress. Which after getting waters we would not see for another 15 minutes. Service was terrible.  No it was TERRIBLE! 

We waited so long that we finally asked the manager if we could put in our appetizer. Usually when you asked the manager for something and say we have not seen our waitress at all in a long timethey usually come and check on the table multiple times. Not here... 

Was very excited to have a bdubbs close to home, but wow. Not if this is how this place is always going to be 

Oh and DO NOT order the quesadillas, dry, and grosssss!!

We sat here without any of the waitresses  (yes multiple waitresses walked by and ignored us) for about 20 minutes without even so much as a head nod.  I would get it if it was busy, but it wasn't. It was just us and a couple of other tables in the dining room. We just got up and left. Pretty fail service.
Fries felt re-heated and covered in salt. We didn't get out appetizer and service always lags.

I have never written a review on Yelp before, but after my most recent visit - I had to. BWW is good. Love their sauces. Been to this location many times. Last visit, hubby and I had the most delightful, smiling, bubbly, and just a complete ray of sunshine server. Even if we got there a little before closing, she was patient with us and gave such above and beyond service. Shea, you are great and it shows that you genuinely care about connecting with people! Keep it up!

I have been to "B-dubs" locations across the country and I always have a fairly pleasant experience. I know some people like to player hate on chains, but I honestly have never quite understood that whole mentality. Does the fact that a restaurant is a chain somehow diminish it by default? Perhaps in the alternate universe some wanna be hipster operates under it does, but to those of us who objectively embrace reality, food and experience is the same no matter if it's a Mom and Pop joint or if they are rocking 1000 units coast to coast. Ok, stepping off the soap box. 

If you have been to any other "B-dubs" location (and unless you have been living under a rock the last decade, chances are you have), you will find many aspects instantly familiar. They have wall-to-wall flat screens that put most sports bars to shame. BWW is very popular with fantasy football followers for this very reason alone. There are not too many places where you can swivel 360 degrees in your chair and get every single live NFL game on Sunday afternoon. I have yet to enter a location that did not have NFL Sunday Ticket, and this location is no exception.  The last couple of years my fantasy football league draft was conducted from the bar stool of a BWW location. Another staple is UFC events, and all the PPW events are on tap here as well. This is actually quite handy if I am traveling. If there is a fight on I want to watch while I am on the road, I know that I can visit the closest location and get my fix. Even some po-dunk towns in the middle of nowhere have  BWW's these days. 

As to the food, wings are what you should go with here (surprise, surprise). They are always plump and succulent and are about the best you will find at any chain. They have sauce selections for days to accommodate just about any preference with 'Blazin' being the hottest. I adore insanely hot food and it is a sauce that is pretty nuclear for a mass produced product. A BWW district manager once told me the sauce is in the 200,000-350,000 Scoville units of heat range. By contrast, Tabasco sauce is between 2500-5000. So, yeah....It is friggin HOT!  If I am not in the mood for wings, I also like the buffalo ranch chicken sandwich which has been on the menu at every location I have ever visited. You can also go bone out on wings and eat them with a fork if you are not wanting to get messy. BWW locations also will serve regional specialty items by location. For example, the location closest to me back in Wisconsin had deep fried cheese curds. 

Lastly, this is a good spot to grab a drink since the 20oz beers are reasonably priced.  This location has decent selection on tap with some local microbrews thrown into the mix to round things out. 

Overall, this location is a good option. Prices are cheap, the service is good, and they have all the "man cave" type of accompaniments that are typical of the chain.

We came here for lunch and had an enjoyable time.

Decor: It's a B-Dubs, so no surprises. There are TONS of TVs... seriously, they are EVERYWHERE! But that's a good thing b/c it's a sports bar.
Bathroom: Again, standard for B-Dubs: clean, well lit, inviting.

Staff: The greeting staff was friendly and we only had to wait a short amount of time, which was cool. Our waitress was nice as well. She wasn't SUPER speedy, but she was doing a fine job and was very friendly.

Food/Drink: The food was, as par for B-Dubs, delicious. It was the highlight of the visit as it was hot and fresh and the sauce-to-wing ratio was fine - mine could have used another spin but my girlfriends were perfect.

Value: Prices are right where you would expect them to be.

We love B-Dubs and will always come back for more wings or to catch a game.

Only giving two stars because the food is delicious.. Waitress was SO rude, nasty and awful that we seriously will not be returning to this location. They either need to reevaluate their staff, or lose customers.

I guess it's good for another wing option to open up nearby. Unfortunately the traditional wings were slightly dry and overcooked, and the food came out very slow. Especially for 2:00 on a Saturday afternoon, which is just after the Saturday lunch rush.

I had the traditional wings. Half were covered with a limited edition, Salted Caramel sauce (which is just honey BBQ with a touch of caramel, and kosher salt) while the other half was covered in Caribbean Jerk sauce, which I knew I would like quite a bit.

I'm glad, for one, they're experimenting with different kinds of sauce. The salted caramel was complex enough, and not too sweet (though my wife said it was too sweet for her tastes.)

The drumsticks were cooked well enough but the wings were a bit overcooked and stringy. We also grabbed the soft pretzels, which were good.

In addition, the food came out pretty slow (15-20 minutes), with no explanations from the wait staff. I also mysteriously got a drink refill I didn't ask for. :-p

The experience wasn't a deal-breaker for the future, but I'm not particularly aching to go back either.

The food was excellent but the service was not. We got seated right away and our server came over. He took 5 minutes to ask us what we wanted to drink! Isaac our waiter was so slow. Our food took about 15 minutes to come out!!! It usually takes only 10. When we were finished we asked to get the check and he wouldn't come back. Instead he was cleaning the tables and moping around!!! It took 15 minutes for him to come to get out check and come to get our card back. Isaac needs to be way faster and pay more attention to his work/job!!! Overall the wings were excellent! I got the garlic Parmesan wings! They were to die for! I will be coming back but hoping that Isaac won't be out waiter!

Im only giving it 1 star because the Bartender was very helpful, when I brought my Mom there for her 73rd BDay. We waited at the bar for 40 mins after we were told 20mins and my phone would notify me. It didn't, so I go to the VERY VERY RUDE waitress and she told us we missed it and we would have to wait another 30-40 mins. The bartender did make something happen and got us a table in the bar area. I went back on Tuesday 1/26/2016 and ordered XXX CRISPY Salt & Vinegar, they gave my reg & lemon pepper. I took them back the GM on duty would not refund my money because I didn't have my receipt but i showed him on my phone the transaction. Was rude and uncaring also for a GM. He gave me 2 freaking snack pack cards that I can only use at that HORRIBLE LOCATION. I perfer the HOFFMAN ESTATES location by far! Don't recommend it

This place earns 5 Stars because of their awesome service!

Every server, bartender, guest experience champion, and manager seems to enjoy their job and dealing with customers.  They are always great at remembering me and my order!  This Buffalo Wild Wings definitely provides better service and more consistent food quality then other nearby locations, definitely my go-to B Dubs.

Food is always brought out quickly and hot!  Highly recommended.  They have multiple specials throughout the week, I myself come regularly on Mondays for their "double punch" Mondays.  (they have a lunch card that after 5 punches you get $5 off).

I definitely recommend this location if you have a taste for Wings, Fries, and other fried goodies!

If I could give this place no stars, I would.  First we waited 15 min and no one even approached us as a server, bus person.  I finally asked a girl bussing tables who was our server.  Turns out the server didn't know we were his table, which was smack in the middle of the dining room.  I was with my two 8-yr-old children and we had just come back from a dr's appointment after a diagnosis for my daughter.  I thought it would be a nice treat.  Think not.  I ordered a prem. margarita, which was 99 % ice.  I called the server over to show him and he sent the manager over.  She said everything is premeasured, that's the margarita glass, so the rest has to be filled with ice.  I expressed my dissatisfaction and she asked if I'd care for another with not so much ice,  I said fine.  We were served our dinner, two kids meals and I had the Med. salad. I've been to Buffalo Wild Wings in Naperville and in Lombard, and the serving sizes were much smaller at this Bloomingdale location.  I asked for a carry-out box for my salad and the check.
In the meantime I was brought another margarita with less ice, of which I finished 1/2, and the check.  I come to find out they had charged me for the 2nd margarita I had sent back.  I spoke again to the manager and she said, oh, no, if you drink it, you have to pay for it.  I said there was hardly anything to drink and I thought you were bringing me another one with less ice.  I asked to speak to her manager.  He proceeded to tell me that "by law" they have to charge me for alcohol "if I drank it."  I said I will pay for one, but not the other.  This was $10 we were arguing over.  The bill was 42 something and I handed him $40.  He asked me if I had paid my bill.  I told him I will give him $40 and nothing more.  He proceeded to tell me that he would call the police on me for not paying my bill.  I told him I am 59 yrs old with 2 adopted children who's worked in the court system  as a stenographer for over 30 yrs.  I handed him the remaining $2.42 cents and left.  I have never been so insulted in my 59 years on this earth.  Where has common sense gone?  Where has respect for the customer gone?  The place was dirty, the customer service horrible and the portions significantly less than other Buffalo Wild Wings.  

So Customer Beware.  Buffalo Wild Wings are independently owned and operated.  I would  think again before supporting the Bloomingdale location.

Update: contacted http://www.buffalowildwings.com/en/contact-us/.  The form could not be processed due to "missing fields" which were filled out two separate times... can't even make a complaint to them!

This is not necessarily a review on the Buffalo Wild Wings food, which I love, but more the service of this particular restaurant. My husband and I ordered lots of wings on New Years eve with the Hot BBQ sauce, which is really hot for me, and ranch. I called early and made sure to double check that we would receive ranch with the wings. The woman on the phone assured me a few times that it would be in the bag. It ended up taking us almost a half hour to get to this BWW. My husband ran in and grabbed the bag and we headed home. When we sat down at our dinner table I realized that they had neglected to put even one cup of ranch into our bag. I was not about to waste another hour of my night to drive back for the ranch that the servers forgot to place in the bag, so I called BWW to see if they could give me a free credit of some ranches for my next visit.

I had to cycle through at least 3 girls who basically told me "it's JUST ranch." and whined about how busy they are. When I'm spending a decent amount of money on hot spicy wings, it's more than JUST ranch, and BWW is ALWAYS busy. They should have bags filled with silverware and ranch ready to go if they can't remember these items. I finally got a manager on the phone who I regretfully forgot to ask for his name, but was so flustered from the last 3 girls that I had to explain my situation to. I just wanted them to take my name so next time I wouldn't have to pay for ranch that I was shorted on this visit. The manager took my full name and address and told me he would send me a coupon for some free wings to compensate for my time and apologized. I told him I wasn't looking for free wings, but very much appreciated getting taken care of. 

It's been over a month and NO coupon or any mail has arrived at my house from BWW. I understand that it's JUST ranch, but service for customer's should be handled MUCH better than this. I will not be returning to this restaurant and will make sure everyone else that I know, many whom love BWW, will choose the Schaumburg branch or different restaurant altogether.

I order from here a few times a month for lunch at work.  Always hit or miss.  Sometimes good sometimes bad, never great.  Do not ever order on Monday though.  Ordered 11 boneless hot always with extra sauce.  No sauce and wings were as hard as a rock like they were saved from Sundays football night and thrown in a microwave.  Completely disgusting!  Called and complained and manager said he was sending me a coupon for a free lunch.  Not sure if I even want to use it, have not received it yet anyways!

I have always loved buffalo wild wings but it does appear their quality is falling just like hooters did.  I am just waiting for the blue cheese to come out in a prepackaged container then I know it is time to look for another wing shop.  I hope they can fix things because I do enjoy the environment.

I will never eat here again.  The food took a very long time to cook.  It tasted terrible.  It was way over priced and it gave me diarrhea.  I will never ever go here again.  You have all been warned.  Absolute horrible experience.

This place needs some help.  Like managerial help.  Because the kids they have running it are clueless.   It takes forever to get a table.  Even longer to get your drinks. And by the time they actually take your order and decide to bring your food, you're so frustrated and bitter that you just want to get the heck out of there.  And call for carry out some time.  I dare you.  What you will get is someone who is completely rude, condescending and dumb. Went here last night with the hubby and i think our dining experience was all right. Our server, jenny (if i remember the name right) was very nice and attentive. Marisa was our Server. She was absolutely delightful with her cheerful and bubbly disposition.

Captain Josh was also great. ....
Great fast service. .

Excellent Service!!!  We came in late in the day on Sunday and it was very crowded.  After a short wait we were sat down but nobody waited on us for about 15 minutes. Keep up the good work and excellent customer service!

I am a Bdubs addict and I really thought this particular store was amazing. It was very clean and I thought that the service was excellent. This bdubs was clean and awesome service.  Keep up the good work!

BWW has increased their prices yet again, which isn't the fault of a single chain restaurant, but sending out crappy food is.

We ordered a variety of wings, and they were all barely sauced, it was disappointing.
Paying more for food that has declined in quality sucks. We will not be going back to this location.

I was here shortly after this location opened.  This was My first time coming back, and it's not exactly what I remember it being. Our waitress Michelle, was very Nice, and did a good job of keeping our drinks refilled. The food isn't  that great, definitely not worth the prices on the menu.  I got a burger, and it's nothing to remember. There are plenty of TV's for viewing when there a game on. Otherwise, I've been to bigger and better places.

Poorly staffed and the place is a mess! I would've given this 1 star but our waiter was the only one on the floor and he was really busting his behind trying to take care of everyone. We were told we should have had the hostess seat is but they would take us anyway since we were already seated. Most of the tables that didn't have guests already seated there were dirty. We found the one clean table. At no time during the hour we were here were any of those tables cleaned. The wings were good though, so no complaints there, but management needs to get the staffing right. This isn't the first time I've seen this at this location.

So my friend places the order and I go to pick it up. I get to the cashier and I know from previous bdubs experience and friends working there that the person answering the phone is the same person who is at the register...so I saw the girl in the flesh...and she did the same things she did to me on the phone in person! Yet again I was in the middle of talking to her and she answers the phone without warning. What?!

And also...the whole time I'm talking to her she never made eye contact. This girl had a serious attitude problem.
When I got my wings, I asked about why I didn't get any carrots/celery and ranch and she says that that doesn't qualify on the special days or something...but no where on any sign or anything did it state that. 

I then asked for extra dipping sauces and she responded as if it was the biggest task in the world. It's not like I was asking her to wipe my butt. But she acted like it.
So rude.

Thankfully the food was decent so I was content but thinking back on the service I was given by this girl from the absolute beginning of my interaction with bdubs that day is extremely disappointing. Now I know why everyone says to go to the one on Roosevelt road in Lombard!

How can you mess up wings? I ordered wings with bones and they were overcooked, dried, and didn't even taste like chicken. I was disappointed. 

It also took 20 minutes for my brother and I to sit at a bar table and get service. I had to go ask someone to take our orders. They apologized and said that they were in between switching shifts but I don't think that would ever take 20 minutes. LAZINESS. I watched waitresses stand against the wall together talking. Poor working! Sorry, I'm use to going to work and working my tail off!

I do love buffalo wild wings' garlic parmesan bonelss wings...great hangover food.

I'm not sure what all the hype is about this place because there's nothing special about it. I'll give it 3 stars because I cant say I had very high expectations and it isn't claiming to be a gourmet wing joint. It's a chucky cheese for teenagers and for some reason the entire place always smells like the filthy ball pit in a Mcdonald's playland. Time to clean your carpets scumbags.   

One thing that is completely obnoxious about this place is the constant barrage of employees that bother you from the minute you sit down until the moment you leave. When I'm hungry and sit down to eat I don't want to do any surveys, and I don't give a shit if it's wacky wing month or whatever. Let me eat my fkn food! If your list of specials take you more than 5 minutes to list than you should do everyone a favor and write them down and STFU. No one cares.  It's excruciating to sit through. Once you are completely annoyed, they send in some fat buck toothed manager to make small talk and ask how your microwaved chicken wings are???!!! WTF. Bottom line- this place needs to invest in touch screen menus.

Stopped by with kids for lunch.  Can say enough how disappointed with service and food. The wings came up cold. And we didn't care for the sauce  it you can't tell the server of they don't come back up to check on you.  Will never come back. Plenty of other popular wing places opened up.  all I can say is disappointed.

ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE SERVICE! 

I love buffalo wild wings dont get me wrong but this location is by far the worst bdubs yet.  I have given this place way too many chances and it has been the same horrible service EVERY TIME.  (on days when there are games playing.. dont even THINK about maybe coming here, EVEN WORSE) 

Here is my list of REPETITIVE issues with this location:

-LONG LONG LONG wait.. I'm talking a good 40 minutes and there is very little seating.. so have fun standing.. and when there is a game on.. the wait is more like 2 hours, no joke.

-The employees lie to you saying it will be about 15-20 minutes.. ya 20 minutes my ass. 

-EXTREMELY slow service, just to get your waiter to your table is another 30 minutes of waiting

-when you FINALLY get your food (after about an hour and a half of waiting since you got there) its cold.

- when you finally get your cold food that you have been waiting hours for, they mess up your order, or they tell you the rest of it will come out later, which is awesome because I love eating a whole basket of wings and then 30 minutes later being able to eat my fries separately, NOT. 

*keep in mind ALL of these issues have happened EVERY time I have gone.

Never asked  where we wanted to sit. Placed us in bar  area.  Not much room and with all the people walking past it is cold. Very disappointed, all most all of our food come to the table cold.  Our  waitress never paid attention to us until  her friends  left. Had to ask  manager for hot food. He took it and never came back. Finally waitress  brought us hot food. Not happy.

I've tried this one several more times and realized that you have to order the boneless wings extra wet and even then, there's barely any sauce. Seriously, this location is awful, do not waste your money. They even burnt the buffalo chips and not in a good way. They were inedible. I will travel to other suburbs for my bww fix in the future. This franchise definitely needs new leadership.

Don't plan on quick service for your food.  I've waited less for aged slow cook steaks at 5 star restaurants.   The B-Dubbs TV makes the wait less bothersome.   Beer list could use some updating as well.

I know what I'm getting at wild wings. Ok food,  cold beer, decent service... Well two out of three shouldn't be bad but it is. Sat at the bar and while served it was with no personality unless you were part of the sausage fest bar team bantering with the male servers. For the wild wing management that cares, it's the staff that is on the moment this is being written and posted. My wife and I are fans of the concept but we both leave tonight disappointed after our time at your bar. We will try again but won't give you another chance if we witness another frat party minus any girls.

Dining with kids tonight. Couldn't put together a table of 8. Got our order right but auctioned our food off. Forgot a children's meal. Drinks empty halfway through our meal. Trash piling up because we're done. The MOD even walked by without grabbing something. Where our waitress is... I'm not certain.

Okay, maybe they worked out the quirks from all of the other reviews?  I was apprehensive to go to this bdubs, but it is now the closest one to my house so I agreed to go to watch the mma fight. 

I had two of their specialty drinks.  I'm not sure how much alcohol was in the drinks,but they still tasted great.  Our server was good, I didn't eat anything but the rest of the table seemed fine with their choices.

Had a great first trip to this bdubs. Bella was our server and she was funny, quick and could put up with me and my friends so that says something! 

Wings were good. Not my personal favorite place to go for hot wings but they have good flavors. Carribean jerk and Asian zing are the best! 

Lots of tv's. Projectors and LCD's. Had the new Sharp 90" tv's and Da Bulls game looked good up there. 

Overall, service was excellent, wings were alright and the entertainment value is there. Perfect for watching any sports where you want wings and beer.
Really bad service. Skipped over 3 times to be seated. Waited over 10 min and not offered to be seated. Manager on duty did not care about the situation.

Have been here multiple times along with my boyfriend and his siblings. It's a good place to come and enjoy the game with some good food. However this is a sports bar, so do expect delays on busy days.

It's very crowded in the lobby, walked to the bar past at least 10 open tables in dinning area and the bar, then was told it will be a 20 minute wait. Saw a bunch of open tables in the patio and was told it'll be 20 minutes.

For a giant restaurant chain, the quality of their service depends on location and manager on-site.  Some shifts, BWW is great and not so much on others.  I avoid it here if it's busy.  Most of their servers don't give a shit.  They forget the basic things like napkins, straws, and extra boats which can be a bit aggravating.  On other occasions, the food is on the lower end of quality.  Overall, this location is OK.

I like the atmosphere of this location, some other locations (Geneva for example) are extremely loud with the music, tvs, and the loud speaker/microphones. The patio area is relaxing when it's nice enough out to sit outside. Usually my boyfriend and I go to this location and we get pretty good service! It's nice to see friendly faces when we walk in and the servers will always way or stop by to say hi..

They usually have some type of promotion going on: Tuesdays/Thursday wing specials.

Food always good, as we usually order our "usual favorites" ;) Sometimes when its crowded, it is a little chaotic...but hey...what bar isn't.

Overall, it's a great place to sit down and eat some good food =)

Alright place to go to on a Tuesday.

Service is attentive on most nights. Quality of service ranges from okay to good. I've been here a few time to know that service won't kill your mood here at least.

Food:
Hot and Saucy wings! It's what you go here for of course! My favorite choice is the Garlic Parmesan because of how all the flavors fight for the affections of your taste buds. I find the chicken to be acceptable on most nights. To be honest, nothing wows me on the menu after the many times I have visited. But to be fair, I only go here for the wings so I am extremely limited. Don't get the fries.... I usually just go nuts on the edible wings.

Atmosphere:
A bit overstimulating if you are an introvert. Lots of TV's, a jukebox with a loud sound system. This place feels like it is made for the sports fan and the UFC junkie. I can't appreciate though because I am neither of those types. I am sure a lot of people can appreciate the effort though.

This place isn't really for me, but I gotta say it is fun to be here with a group of friends. I am sure this is a perfect place for the Sports and UFC fans, but it just isn't for me. I like the Garlic Parmesan wings though.

I actually called out my bill when I was over charged and was told "if you come back, I will take care of you"...How about taking it off my bill now. Its a shame because I live close..cold, bad food + bad service is not a good equation. This place is off my rotation list, I will go to another location.

I usually receive great service at any other Buffalo Wild Wings location but this one was terrible. They gave us two waiters, the second was in case the first was busy. But when we called him, he was busy too. Not to mention they sent the first waiter on his break during our meal so it took our food forever to come to the table and they had some other waitress serving us. A drink was spilled by accident and nobody cleaned it up after we mentioned it to the staff. Asked for ketchup, it was brought after we were basically done with our meals. Never visiting this location again.

Done with this place for a while. Horrible staff. Don't bother trying to call in an order. Twice in a row. I was put on hold for 7 minutes at a non peak time. Ordered and was quoted 10 minutes. Showed up in about 15..order wasn't even attempted to be cooked. Cashier said 5 more minutes. He disappeared in the back for 10 minutes and the manager scrambled to help those waiting at the register. Another 15 minutes goes buy and no food. I ask and manager says it'll be out in a few. Another 5 minutes goes by and he comes scrambling out of the kitchen with my 18 wings in hand. Bag in another. 45 mins during a non peak time for a small order is unacceptable. Couple days go by and I try to order tonight l. I was placed on hold for a few minutes and when they got me off hold the employee hung up on me before I could even say hello. Thanks but daily specials aren't worth the headache. Even with the specials it is still a premium place to eat with a meal ranging from 12-15 before tip.

Flew in for work on Friday, went out to Buffalo Wild Wings later that night with friends. I just wanted a relaxing evening with beer and wings, and did not want the hassle of driving into Chicago, and this place was on point. The waitress was super attentive, the beers came out cold, and the wings were hot.

I mean, that's all you really need, right? Obviously I obliterated the wings and went through my beers like they were the only source of fresh water on a deserted island, but it was the legit experience. You can't really put a price on that, especially for an out-of-towner.

As an update- we've been here several times now since my last review. We usually go here when we can't think of anything else. 

The problem is that we've noticed the past two times after eating here we've both not felt well the next day. I'm not saying food poisoning or anything like that because it wasn't, and I do know that buffalo wings aren't the best for one's stomach. However, last time we just had a few wings and I had a wrap, yet the next day my wife and I felt nauseated all day long. 

We made the decision to not eat here anymore.

I'm a fan of this place but if you're one of those people who want to focus on the game you're watching, this isn't the place for you. Here is why:

I tried watching a football game here but the problem is its way too loud to hear any of the commentary or calls. If you care about the audio in a game you should've probably just watched at home. They play music which drowns out any sounds from the tv's. 

Now on to the food:

A word of advice about the wings. If you want to try alot of different varieties of sauces, go on a cheap wing night (i think tues/thurs) the wings are cheaper and physically smaller so you'll get to eat more. Also go with a bunch of people because they have bulk discounts on wings. 

I recommend the bone in wings more than the boneless ones. The boneless wings are usually dry in the middle and hard fried on the outside. 

The sauces are pretty darn good here. I like the teriyaki or carribean jerk. If you have cuts on your hands or lips, NEVER get the blazin wings.

Potato wedges are tasty also, their seasoning is good. 

A note on the atmosphere, it is LOUD in here. Don't bother trying to carry a long conversation here unless you like yelling. 

Overall I'd say this place is great for wings but not that good for watching sports. 

Give it a shot if you're in the mood to sauce up your fingers and face.
Ordered wings for takeout. Very slow food service. Inattentive carry out staff.  Ask for extra wet wings which are very good.

Only ordered here twice but they managed to mess up my take out order twice. One time I specifically asked for knives and napkins and I didn't get any. Both times I got some raw tasting wings.  I've gotten some "dud" pieces, which are pretty much quarter sized boneless wings.  They messed up my order confusing traditional with boneless on boneless wing days :/

All that aside, most of the pieces that were not "raw" were fine tasting.  Nice building.  The staff seems to be struggling, young highschool kids that don't really know how the ins and outs of dining.
Love this place! I usually go to catch a game and have some wings & beer.... Servers are awesome and the energy is good. Overall good experience and it's one of my go to spots lately : )

Let me start off by saying I have reviewed a couple other locations and this, even though it was for take out, was by far the best.  Greeted with happy smiles, not the forced ones.  The girl who helped me with my order was a doll.  Every worker I would make eye contact with while entering or leaving, just seemed to like their jobs.  To me, that makes a huge difference.  This will definitely be a go-to spot.  Best vibes and service of any of the BWW I've been to so far.  See you guys soon.

Food has been good every time I've been here. However, service has been subpar every time. Long time for waitress to come, long time for food to arrive (takes as long to get wings as it would a steak) and last time order got messed up. They make the waitresses remember and not write down what you want. Why? Fail.

Not really a fan of this place. I didn't like it years ago and when I tried it again about a month ago I didn't like it much then either. The food isn't bad per se, it's just overpriced for what you get. If anything I'd come here for appetizers and/or dessert but definitely not for a meal. The wings at Bulldog Ale House in Carol Stream are much better!

We went here to watch the Buffalo Wild Wings Bowl since my fianc is an alum of one of the schools that was playing. Upon entering we were told that they would not be playing that game because it was UFC fight night. What?!? I know it's not this restaurants fault but why sponsor a game if you're not going to show it at your locations? They put it on a small TV near our table for us. Anyways... Seems like the fight nights bring in a rough clientele so avoid going on those nights if that's not your scene. 

We ordered the pretzels and fried pickles for appetizers, both of which were good. The traditional wings we ordered were soggy and undercooked. Wing Stop's are much better and saucier. 

The worst part was the service. Mostly high school kids who were rude and didn't seem to have a clue. Probably will not be back to this location.

This corporate location is amazing. The server, Alfonso was one of the best servers I have ever had at any restaurant by far even when I was a little difficult on deciding on a sauce I liked. Lol. After we ate, the manager came by to make sure we were ok and ended up sitting down & talking with us for 10mins about the different locations. She was so friendly. I live in Chicago and just happened to be in Bloomingdale for my 6 year anniversary and I definitely will drive from Chicago to come here again! 5 stars ALL the way!
Food is good but it takes forever for them to acknowledge you when you're trying to pick up food. Not just on a Saturday but on weekdays too. I'm not a fan, I'll get my wings somewhere else.
Sat in bar area.  Very typical BWW, good service, good food, but nothing amazing.

I would say this is one of the better BWW i have gone to. The waiters and staff are very attentive. I had the manager stop by the table asked how the service was and how the food was. I couldnt be happier with my food and service for this location.

Great food as every other bdubs. All the employees are idiots. Young kids in hs. Not friendly, helpful or prompt. Been there 3 times since they open & it's the same everytime. One time I did a "pick up", LITERALLY 7 people behind the counter & not one said hello or asked if they could help me. It was basically social time and they were jus hanging out laughing, talking... Completely disregarding I was there. Asked me if I wanted a drink (came with my sons meal) and she forgot it. I was so tired and frustrated with the whole take out experience that I just said F it..... If it weren't that it was so close and my fianc LOVES the food I would absolutely never go back.

My friends and I come here all the time and we love it. The service has always been great, the food is awesome, and they always have whatever game you're looking for on a few of the TVs. If I were ever to have any sort of a complaint, it might be that there are SO MANY TVs that it can be distracting, but I think that's a personal ADD problem on my end, so it wont affect my star rating. Love it there, you should go.

My rating ranges from a 2 to a 4 for an average of a 3. 
2 =  if there is a wait of 20 minutes or more than 5 tables ahead of you... Advise you to WALK AWAY and GO ELSEWHERE.... when they are busy you will get slow service, the order may not come out all at once, and the food may be cold. Once they are busy and behind the 8 ball the service and accuracy of orders falls apart. To the managers credit, they have done their best to fix problems when you complain but by then everyone is eating at different times. 

4 =  If they are full but medium to slow busy. 
Pro's: Good for kids and enables parents to have a little break. There is noise and activity so you don't have to worry if a child gets a little upset or if your friend's child is going through a random scream phase. They have a free hand held game, with Free games, unlike some nearby places. Food has been served hot and of good quality. Amount of sauce on bone in wings has been perfect but boneless ones need a little bit more. They can usually bring out the kids food quicker but be warned that it will be HOT and need to cool down.
Cons:  The server is usually different from the person who delivers the food and this can cause a disconnect if order needs any adjustment. Prepare to mention it to both people who stop by the table as the delivery person does not always communicate with the server. Sometimes the kids food is too Hot and can take 10 min to cool down enough for them to eat.

I was pretty excited when this place opened last year, but every experience we have here is worse then the one before it.

We went last night and when we walked in we thought we would be seated right away due to the fact that half the patio was open and there were over a handful of seats open in the main dining room. The hostess told us that it would be at least a 15 minute wait and I asked if there was a wait for the patio since it was half empty and she replied with the excuse "I don't know. I am here alone and haven't checked." A couple came in right after us and said they wanted to sit on the patio and were seated right away.

After we were seated the service was sub-par and we were surrounded by tables with food under them and covered in trash for longer than they should have been. 

When we left at 9:45 the hostess still had a waiting list going even though there were over 8 tables open in the main dining room and the patio was less than half full.

I think this location needs to train its staff on better service, checking on tables and really assessing "wait times" when there clearly shouldn't be wait times.

I'm giving this place two stars because my review is based on ordering carry out on Superbowl Sunday.  I know it's probably one of the busiest days of the year for them, but that being said you'd think they would have a better method for getting carry out orders out.  When I called they said it would be an hour and twenty minutes, which I was fine with.  When I arrived an hour later, it was mass chaos.  Once I paid I was told to wait by the special tables set up in the bar area.  The tables had so many people crowded around them you couldn't even get close.  They were set up by alphabet, and the A-G tables were empty.  I was waiting for a B order so I figured my order wasn't ready yet.  After about 20 minutes with only one girl trying to get orders out, I noticed there was a bag on the M-Z table that no one had touched.  I finally pressed my way through about 5 people to get close enough to check the receipt name, and sure enough it was my order.  There was no one to confirm with, so I just grabbed our bag and pushed through the growing crowd to get out.  People dining in were getting annoyed because they couldn't get through the crowd to the bathroom, and it was so  loud you couldn't even hear the game! When I got my food home it was cold and the order was wrong (sauces were incorrect, and cheese that was supposed to be on the side for the fries was cold and globbed on top. We had to toss the fries.) It was a waste of money for the cold food we didn't really enjoy.  Won't order from here again but would perhaps try dining in some time when there's no big sporting event going on.

I have been there several times and the service has been superb everytime from Nikki, great wings cold beer and excellent service, ask a captain for game board, helps to past the time. My favorite sauses are mango habanero and  spicy garlic. On my birthday I got to choose a bottle of sauce to take home.
Great service and great food. This is one of the best run B'dubs i've been to.

My first time to a BDubs and I loved it! Luckily there was a Hawks game on . Was impressed by the staff person who came around and told us we could contact her to make our experience there more enjoyable! The waiter was attentive and the food was good. Can't wait to go back and try more ! (Next Hawks game!) The only thing I would have liked was for them to explain the menu more being it was my first time.

This place was horrendous! WOW! I never in my life complain about places unless the service was unbearably bad but this is one of those times. Our waitress was a sweet girl but I don't think it's possible to wait on 9 tables and everybody to be content. First, the fries I got were horrible, sent them back. Second, they gave me the nasty white ends of all the celery, sent it back. After I sent that back the COOK came out, pointed at me, and started laughing. I literally was in SHOCK. So not only did that make me ridiculously uncomfortable, all the employees had their friends there and all the waiters/bartends/waitresses decided to sit and reminisce with their friends while there are customers waiting to get their bill! Plus, after all the employees got off the clock they just grabbed some beer and hung out with their friends. How unprofessional. GO HOME PEOPLE. The manager was walking around the whole time acting like he didn't see the stupidity of all his employees. This place needs some serious help!!!!!!!

The service at this restaurant was always pretty mediocre, but my recent visit will definitely be the last I ever make to this or any other BW3.  Now, you can't order a dozen wings...  You order a "large", which will be a variable number, depending on the average size of wings on that day, which is insane...  How do I split the order so that my kids get equal numbers of the flavor they want?  But wait...  It gets worse...  Apparently, they now pile them all together on the same tray.  This means that my super hot ones are served on top of my son's mild ones, and the sauces are all mixed together.  Multiple requests to fix the problem resulted in the manager "making a special exception" and separating them into their own paper trays (like they always have in the past).  After all of that, it took over an hour to get our order right, and what did they offer in order to make up for the whole fiasco?  $5 off of our next visit.  No point.  We gave the coupons back, stiffed the waitress, and will never go back to that or any other Buffalo Wild Wings again.  Nearly 20 years of going at least twice a month, but I guess they don't care.

Compared to other locations, this locations was okay. It is is a little bit smaller than all of the other locations. It is nice to have a location close to home, becuase I used to have to go to the one in Warrenville or Lombard which is kind of a drive for me. When we got there, we did not have to wait which was nice. Wh were greeted by our server quickly, but both of my parents were carded. So, no matter how old you are, make sure to have an ID on you! We ordered our food and it seemed to take a little bit of time to get to our table. Our waitress told us she was going to check on our food, but when she came back out, she never said anything to us. A few minutes later, our food was out at the table. I generally order one of the chicken wraps when we go on a night where the wings aren't on special. When I got the wrap, it seemed like it was missing ingredients compared to all of the other locations I have been to. I understand this is a new restaurant and they are all adjusting to this. Hopefully the next time I go back, service is a little quicker.

cant beat the best wings ever, the staff is pretty slow, went there for the bears game sunday, I was told the wait was and hour, i was going to leave but i decided to take a look for myself, what do you know there were five tables with nobody sitting at them, i took my seat and told my party to com sit with me, no one seemed to care or even seemed to notice that we snuck right in pass the line, btw, those five tables could have seated everyone that wa waiting, 12 people-12 seats go figure, maybe they wanted to seem busier than they really were, if it wasnt for their good food i would rate the staff as a 1 star

Traditional Italian comfort cuisine.  

Don't miss out on the artichoke appetizer.  Roasted with butter and breadcrumbs.  It was a fun and relaxing way to start dinner and get into your wine and a bargain at the same time.

The wine list I thought was a bit spartan.  Not a large list in general, and especially in the few Italian choices.  Not that it's inadequate, but I just would've expected the wine list to match the large menu.

The pastas were phenomenal, in particular the bolognase, and can definitely be shared by a few as a primi or as a large main course. I really liked their option for penne versus the traditional long noodle. Big, rich flavor really rose to the occasion. 

The patio is very comfortable on a warm summer evening.  Will definitely keep in in mind as a west suburban go-to.
The new owner is simply phenomenal! He has taken the restaurant to a new level! I would definitely recommend giving this place more than a glance!

My friend and I visited Addison, IL.  When I Google food, the first that popped up is Zazas Italian. We tried it and we were not disappointed. The ambiance  is very nice. The fish entrees were cooked to perfection. The portions are huge (bring your appetite).  The server (her name is Kim) is very friendly.  She made us feel so welcome in IL when she found out we are visiting from CA (much appreciated).

I've driven by Zaza's several times and have even been at neighboring businesses, but realize I'd never noticed it before.  I'm glad I had the opportunity to change that the other night!

Ambience - in the bar area, of all places - was actually pretty nice. We sat right by the toasty warm fire. Speaking of toasty - the complimentary bread was nice and steamy!

I had the chicken polenta dish ($17) and, like a schmuck who doesn't appropriately pair my wines with my proteins, a glass of Mnajtrois (mixed red, $7). The pour was generous.

The chicken (2 breasts) was delicious: very tender and perfectly cooked, saucy, and seasoned well. It was topped with big chunks of fresh mushrooms. The side of spinach was generous and lightly steamed. I'd never had polenta before, and it was sadly the most "forgettable" part of the dish... I think just due to the fact that the portion of it was literally dwarfed by the chicken.

My +1 had a pasta dish and he requested a different pasta than was listed on the menu, plus veggies that were also not listed. He was accommodated with a smile, which I thought was very nice. 

Our young male server was personable and attentive without being overbearing. The only thing I thought was a bit unprofessional was the PDA between him and a female hostess - bear hugs and neck nuzzling. (Ahh, young love!) I felt a bit uncomfortable with the scene, but luckily they didn't carry on too much. 

The server gave us complimentary cannoli at the end of the evening, which I guess makes up for it. :)

"Generous" actually seemed to be the norm: pours, entree sizes, and that nice cannoli. Color me impressed!

Zaza's ended up being better than "JUST another Italian place," and I'd definitely head back for another meal.

About 4 years ago I had a bad experience at ZSA ZSA in Addison Illinois.  Went for girlfriend birthday party and service was terrible.  We chose not to give the 20% tip because of the lousy service.  The waitress came back with the bill and told us that we did not leave a 20% tip.  That was the last time I was there.  I recently received a gift certificate and we decided to go there on 09-10-16 in Addison.  Everything was fine until we received our bill and at the end of the bill in big letters there was a message that stated "SHE IS THE BITCH THAT".  I showed the bill to my boyfriend and he was fuming.  I then called the waitress  over to ask to speak to manager when my boyfriend explained to her why we were calling the manager over.  She then took the bill out of my hand and explained to me that this was not meant for me and that she was embarrassed (as she should be)  she claimed that this was for another customer.  Whether it was for me or not this is how a waitress conducts business?  This is not acceptable.  I did not talk to the manager as I should have.  She asked me several times if I wanted to.  I thought when she asked me that , that I would not be really talking to the manager.  Why would she insist for me to talk to manager?  She again apologize and asked if she could do anything for me?  Why would I have to come up with what they could do for me that is something that they should be worried about.  I insisted our dinner be paid for.  Needless to say they paid for it and we left without talking to manager.  I have posted the picture of the bill on facebook and mentioned the incident.  I will never go back and will not recommend this to anyone.

Mixed experience here. 

Service from Victor (who came recommended on other reviews) was rushed and impersonal. 

Food also mixed- see my posted pics. Caprese salad and pasta special were mediocre to awful. Canned crab meat as a sauce base? Yuck! Shrimp mixed in a pasta dish with tails still on? Just wrong. And $24!

The pasta abruzzese was actually quite good. 

Overall, an expensive, forgettable meal. I've had 5-star food and service at the Clarendon Hills location of ZaZa's.

Unfortunately Zaza's isn't great. Mediocre food as well as service. Although she was very nice to allow us to try 2 wines before we decided which we wanted to order, I had an adjustment to a menu item and our server insisted (server times) that I did not tell her. Even though I was not arguing the point, she kept making her point that had I told her she would have made sure the dish came without avocado. There were 5 other people at my table that heard me say it. 
The risotto side dish wasn't risotto at all. No way it was made with arborio rice and after the avocado situation, I realized there was no point in asking. 
The filet was just ok because it wasn't a beautiful, center cut piece. Seemed a bit sad. 
Overall, much better places to spend your money.

In terms of dcor and ambience, ZaZa's leans towards the classier side in this area in a non pretentious way.. when I'm in the mood for this and don't feel like venturing too far away, I come here. 

The warm and inviting bar is wrapped with a copper mosaic tile complimenting the black granite bar top.  There is also a fireplace :) The deep red walls showcase Michelangelo's David.  The lighting sets a romantic tone and it just feels 'swanky'....There's also a few t.v.'s behind the bar.  It's cozy and has a sultry vibe.  Service is friendly and welcoming here.  Some servers have been here a long time and they treat you like they know you...(well they should know me cause I've been here more times than I can remember).  I've been here with dates and friends and we enjoy the selection of potent cocktails.

For Italian fare which happens to include great steaks this place puts out some terrific dishes. For app's - the mussels in tomato sauce are always tasty & if the mussels are not good that night they will tell you if you ask (which I usually do). Have you ever ordered mussels only to find half the shells are empty??  Not cool and just get's my Italian blood pumpin.  The carpaccio with wild mushrooms and avocado is always a must order for me here & the baked goat cheese in tomato sauce while not a complicated dish, satisfies your need for some warm, comforting cheese.  These starters alone could complete my meal & have.

For entrees the pan roasted chicken with roasted artichoke hearts in a tomato sauce with melted mozzarella and side of linguini is delicious.  I especially LOVE the artichokes (mmmmm) &  reasonably priced compared to some of their other entrees or when you don't feel like spending $30 on a New York strip.  But when you do, this is just as good as some of steaks you'll find at upscale steak houses and it comes with potatoes and a veggie..no this not a la carte.  Entrees are decent portions.   I don't usually order the pasta dishes only because I think spending over $12 on pasta here is a crime especially when its very simply prepared.  Pasta is cheap and so are tomatoes.  I opt for either steak, poultry or seafood specials.  Pizza's are pretty tasty too..

They also have a small outdoor patio.  Just come and hang out at the bar, enjoy the ambience or savor an above average meal.  They'll treat you like a paisano!!!  Salute!

Coming here since they opened. Spent ALOT of money in this place over the years. Refuse to go back because the owner had been so rude to me on three separate occasions...This seems to be a pattern with him as I know many of his customers. I won't spend my money anywhere that treats me with disrespect. Its a well known issue here.

In town for work, Had a filet with a side of pasta(spicy tomato sauce. Its hard to find good pasta sauces now days, this one is top notch. Both the steak and the pasta were excellent. Service was great.

Stopped here for a business dinner. Portions are large... Food was decent, but not to die for. 

I had the lamb - very tender, but a bit bland. The apps were good. We split the meatballs and Italian sausage - plenty for four people. 

We thought the limoncello for the table was being compted based on a food delay and a comment from our waitress... Not the case... That's a bit misleading and leaves a not so
Pleasant taste.
Absolutely excellent!! Easily one of the best Italian restaurants in Chicagoland. It is a must you save room for dessert, the carrot cake is a very unique recipe, maybe the best anywhere.

We went there for the first time last night to celebrate Valentines Day. We were seated promptly despite being very early. Kim was our waitress and was very attentive and helpful in making our dinner selections. She is a great ambassador for the restaurant and very knowledgeable about the menu offerings. Our food arrived and not only were the servings substantial but absolutely delicious. We are looking forward to returning soon!

This place has a nice ambiance for a romantic date for two, or for a group. But it is very dark in here. 

The food was excellent. But it is not cheap and mostly al la carte. A few meals come with side dishes, but not many. 

They are fast and you don't wait on food for long. Bread is at every table, along with oil, salt, pepper, and cheese to dress your bread however you like. 

Parking can be tricky. I got lucky and found a spot right in front. Plan on have to walk a bit if it is a busy night. By a bit I mean from the back of the building to the front. 

I had an allergic reaction to something in my food. I don't know what because I have never experienced food allergy before. It could have been a blessing in disguise and I don't hold the restaurant responsible for this. However I have never experienced anything like it before and for that reason I probably can't eat here again.
Don't miss this place! Food, service, atmosphere- wonderful. The Italian sausage is he most unique dish I've had in months. Kim or Victor will take great care of you!

Menu prices have went way up since the two dollar sign review on yelp. This place is definitely pricey.  That being said food and atmosphere and service were good. However, for these prices it should be more than good.

Italian isn't usually my go-to food but something about Zaza's.... the music, the ambience, the smells, the service-- it all just adds... something. We often sit in the bar when we go which is nice (though there is dining room seating); therefore, we usually get the same waiter! He's great, so nice, so knowledgeable of the menu and wines, and you'd think you were one of his family coming for dinner the way he happily greets you.
    The food has always been great, so far, and I've ordered various dishes. Having just eaten there yet again, whatever I ate was so good that I'm glad I have leftovers. Some sort of gnocchi and shrimp in a garlic cream sauce and what may've been calamari. Definitely recommend it. The desserts are good, my little sister is very fond of the crme brle. Of course you can get some of your typical fettuccini alfredo, but if you consider that a meal you might as well go to Awful Garden-- I mean Olive Garden... though Zaza's F.A. is still no doubt better. 
    This is located right across from Marcus Theatre, the parking lot could be better, it does have a patio if you don't mind being in close proximity to traffic, but all in all I like Zaza's quite a lot. Between the food and the waiters we've had, I'll keep going back again and again.
One word for lunch... Grilled steak salad!! Yum.   We came for dinner few times and have ordered the mussels in marinara sauce, pasta dishes, & steak.  Everything is always delicious!!

My "special" for the night was 3 cheese Ravioli with spinach. The cheese flavoring tasted like Velveeta more than anything. Wasn't good. Didn't eat much of the meal. Otters on our party complained of the quality of the food also. Service was ok. However, we had a large group of 9 and they gave us one check! How difficult would it have been to have split it up for us?? 
And the place was so noisy we couldn't have a decent conversation. We won't be back.

I just had the special salad of the day..

Salad with Filet Mignon meat (cooked to your preference)..very delicious and portions are big.. :) YUM

This is one of my favorite all time spots. I always have the pork chops. But Friday night they were thinner than usual and tough. I was a little disappointed.  Great place though always a high recommendation from me.
I love this place I usually go during lunch and the wait staff is awesome and the food is yummy I've never had a bad experience here
Love, love, love ZaZa's!!! Great food and great service! The salsa that is served with the bread is amazing!

I was glad that I visited Zaza's after it was highly recommended by friends and the hotel I was staying at in Addison.  The city is lucky to have them.  And Zaza's is lucky to have Kim as a server.  She suggested a fantastic Cabernet since they didn't serve zinfandel by the glass. I had the filet mignon which was perfectly cooked medium and Kim had the chef butterfly it so that it cooked evenly.  The filet came with this absolutely dreamy,  buttery, cheesy,  soft but crunchy potato wedge. So yum. Besides being treated like we were dinner guests at our family's home,  Zaza's is clean and neat as well as dark and quite romantic.  Truly the whole package!

Always have a nice time here.  Wasn't always the case.  When they first opened they had an annoying and pretentious valet service and the clientele seemed like Soprano wannabes.  I'd come in and they'd try to seat me out of the way.  Guess they were going for a certain flavor that I didn't' have and ultimately didn't fly because the valet is long gone and so is the pretentious edge. So if you too experienced that and are amazed they're still open, give it another try.  

Service is always good and for dining I prefer the bar (has fireplace) and patio (ditto) to the dining room.  Dining room is nice...it's just preference.  Service is always good.    I especially love the fish here. I've never been disappointed or been with someone who is disappointed with their meal.  All worth trying.  Worth noting is the spinach here.  VERY good...smoky flavor.

Last time I was here was with a 13 year old girl.  They offered to make a lunch portion of the meal for her.  Nice.

Wanting to extend the holiday season a bit longer, six of us dined at Zaza's the day after Christmas. We had the calamari, martinis,and manhattans to start.  We were happy with both.  Our entrees of whitefish, lamb chops,  Italian sausage ( homemade) and seafood pasta were served hot and the portions were quite large. Victor, our waiter, is  one of the reasons we enjoy dining at Zaza's.  He is like the Energizer Bunny and always has a smile on his face.  The tiramisu is a must for dessert.

Zaza is my favorite local place to eat. The atmosphere is great. We typically eat in the bar area. Nice warm decor, bar is beautiful with easy to see TV 's. The fire place is perfect for our winter nights. The patio is very nice  for the spring and summer. 

Our personal server is victor. He is the best. He knows exactly what we want. He treats us like family.  Always makes us leave with a smile on our faces. 

Their menu isn't complicating and it flows well. I had one of the best meals ever here!!  I have never had a subpar meal here. Chef is willing to take an entree on the menu and add a personal twist to it.  

If you  are in the area and are looking for a great place to eat, make it Zaza's. There are a several choices in the area and I visit them as well, but ZAZA is the top!!

Another really great lunch today at Zaza's.  What a great local independent place with excellent food and great ambiance.

Victor, the server is just outstanding and has a wit and charm that keep me coming back.  Even if I've not been in for months, he remembers the exact ice tea I drink and always brings it over.

Typically, I'll eat the sausage ala Zaza - which is their homemade Italian sausage, served with spinach, mushrooms, artichokes and balsamic drizzle. Its an appetizer but more than enough for lunch.  Today, I had the chicken limone and it was outstanding.

Yelp puts this restaurant at $$....Actually, I would say it is $$$. There are a couple of items at $17, a few at $23, more at $26 and then at $33.
We had some common fare...veal parm, roasted chicken and seafood marinara. The veal wasn't the best I have ever had, I actually get very good veal parm right here in Iowa, so I was a little let down. My wife liked here seafood, as it had lobster in it. But the roasted chicken was REALLY GOOD. My daughter ordered it, as was so pleased. She was kind enough to give me a sample...really good stuff!
The service is excellent at this place. My glass was never empty, and our waitress was very kind. We ended up talking with her for a few minutes...which was a welcome gesture. 
I do recommend this place, but 3 1/2 stars instead of 4, due to the red sauce being somewhat bland...needed a little more herbs and zest.

I came here with a friend on Oct 1st, he'd been here several times and suggested I try it. The food was good, especially our grilled calamari app. I think our server was named Carlos, he was very helpful and attentive as well, an asset to the restaurant. I live in the city, but would come back again in a heartbeat!

The setup is pretty nice inside. When you walk in, there is a hostess stand.  To the right is the bar area with seating available.  There are some flat screens behind the bar. To the left is the main dining area.  On a weekday evening it was pretty dead so there was no wait.  Parking outside was ample. Service was good.  I had a pasta dish which was good and portions were big. Good wine selection.  For appetizer, had the calamari was which decent. Prices were reasonable.

Love this place the steaks so tender the fish my favorite.
Their Limoncello Martini's are my drinks 2 and thats all you need
going in today for a birthday dinner

Nice decor, great martini's, good service but the food... Dear lord, the driest chicken Vesuvio ever!!!!! And whatever my bf had chicken prosciutto, mozzarella with a side of stale linguini.. What a shame.. I had high hopes.. We will not be returning

Stopped by for a quick lunch during a weekday and there were quite a few people.  The place itself is very clean and the decor very nice Italian Restaurant-ish.  The service here is great, the host is very friendly and the waitstaff super attentive.

To start they give you warm bread with olive oil & parmesan cheese.  The bread is not the best I've eaten at an Italian restaurant but still very good.  I ordered the Penne Abruzzese (penne with a tomato based sauce with sausage and pancetta).  It was delicious; the penne was al dente and they didn't skimp on the pancetta.  Portion was pretty big, even had enough leftovers to make another meal.

I also ordered a Capellini Pomodoro to go for a friend and they were kind enough to include some of their bread with it!  Just a little example of their kind service that goes along with a great meal.

Decided to try this restaurant. It was nice we sat in the bar. Our entrees were very good and service excellent. I should have ordered what I originally wanted but didn't. It was very reasonably priced. I would like to try them again.

We just ate here for our first time.  The food was great!  Service was good.  We will definitely go back.  My husband ordered the prime rib-eye, which he said was cooked perfectly (medium rare).  I had rigatoni with sausage and broccoli in a light cream sauce.  It was delicious, and the serving was HUGE!  we had fried calamari as an appetizer, which was great, and cheesecake and cappuccino for dessert.  The cappuccino was especially good!

I was very pleased with Zazas Italian steakhouse in Addison. My husband and I stopped by on the spur of the moment and did not know really what to expect. The food was very good. We both ordered the whitefish and it was excellent! The service was very good. We would definitely go there again.

This place is my favorite Italian restaurant in the area.  We went last evening. We started with the bread with olives and melted goat cheese in sauce. OH YUM!  What a fantastic way to start the meal. I then ventured on to the Whitefish with a white wine lemon sauce and capers with sauted spinach on the side.  It was magical, from the first bite to the last to me wanting to lick the plate, it was perfect. My dining partners chose the Rigatoni with scallops (special) and the pasta with carbonara and by the lack of conversation and the ummmmm,s heard throughout the meal, I would say they were very happy.  Dessert was a must.  One had the strawberry dessert, the other the tartufo and I had the carrot cake.  All fabulous as well.
The atmosphere is warm and inviting as is the staff. There were larger groups last evening and you would be concerned the noise level would be high.  Not a problem there.   Our wonderful water man was on top of it every step of the way.  Our waitress is outstanding.  We have had her a few times now and she is excellent, keeping you informed, answering all our questions...just great.
If you haven't been to Zaza'a, I strongly suggest you make the trip

I am always a skeptic when it comes to good food in my 'burb.  Other than some mom and pop type fast food or my local carniceria, my go-to's are always in another 'burb or in Chicago. I was definitely put in my place when my gal pals invited me out for lunch at ZaZa's.
